AttrPrefix.summary: The read-only prefix property of the returns the namespace prefix of the attribute, or null if no prefix is specified.

remarks.para: The prefix is always in lower case, whatever case is used at the attribute creation.

blockquote.para: Note: Only XML supports namespaces. HTML does not. That means that the prefix of an attribute of an HTML element will always be null.

remarks.para: Also, only the xml (for the xml:lang attribute), xlink (for the xlink:href, xlink:show, xlink:target and xlink:title attributes) and xpath namespaces are supported, and only on SVG and MathML elements.

-The properties , returning the qualified name of the attribute, and , its local name.
-The property, returning the namespace prefix of an .

AttrPrefix.value: A string containing the prefix of the namespace the attribute belongs too. If none, it returns null.
